column1: Differences in GW attitudes are significant
Use of infrared is greater post-test than pre-test. Goes from 0 to 7 / 6 in Sandwich / No-pretest groups respectively (tested only for Sandwich group)
Sandwich: pre- to post-test: Increase in self rated knowledge is highly significant
Sandwich: GHG Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
No-pretest: GHG Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
Sandwich: Light Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
No-pretest: Light Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
Sandwich: Energy Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
No-pretest: Energy Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
No-pretest: post-test increase in self rated knowledge (compared to S pre-) is not significant
\emph{Post hoc:} Self-rated knowledge on  post-test is significantly lower for No-pretest than Sandwich group
There is no correlation between self-rated knowledge and GW attitudes on the pre-test
Surprise is not significantly greater in S group than N group
